class.name: CobbAPICell
class.blurb: Functions for working with cells and their lighting properties.

description.p: These functions allow you to work with cells. In particular, you can modify the lighting and fog properties of any interior cell that doesn't use sky lighting, in a manner that persists in the SKSE co-save.
description.h2: An overview of interior cell lighting
description.p: Interior cells have a wide array of lighting properties, allowing for precise control of fog and color. However, an interior cell can also use a lighting template — a separate form that offers the same range of lighting properties. A cell can borrow some or all of its values from its lighting template.

Internally, cells have a set of lighting template usage flags — a bitmask indicating which properties are borrowed from the template. Cells always define the full set of lighting data on their end, but when the game goes to look up a lighting property for the cell, it will first check the template usage flags; if the flag for the property in question is set, then the game will instead grab the property value from the lighting template. If the cell somehow has a template usage flag set without actually having a lighting template to pull from, then the game will still use the cell-side property. Properties are looked up every frame, so any changes you make will be instantaneous (not counting the time it takes for the Papyrus API to actually execute).

If you wish to reset your changes to a cell's lighting properties, please use the "reset" functions. If you get a cell's original values and then set it to those values manually, you will be baking those values into the save; if a mod changes that cell's values, the values you set will take precedence. The "reset" functions avoid this.
Cell color values are represented as integers with the format 0xAABBGGRR. The alpha component is generally unused.
The lighting template usage flags that cells can have are as follows:

templated-content.template:
This parameter determines where we retrieve each property from. The default value for this argument, 1, will make these methods return whatever value the cell is actually using.
Value Meaning
0 Get the current value from the cell
1
Get the current effective data; that is: get the value from the lighting template if the cell's relevant template usage flag is set, or the cell's value otherwise.
2 Get the default value from the cell
3
Get the default effective data; that is: get the value that the cell would pull from its default lighting template, if the relevant template usage flag is set by default, or the cell's default value otherwise.

method.name: ForceUniqueLighting

args.arg: If this argument is True, then the change will be persisted in the SKSE co-save.

method.blurb: This function disables an interior cell's lighting template usage flags, forcing the cell to use only its own lighting values. If this function is called on an exterior cell, it logs a Papyrus error and does nothing.

notes.note: This function is equivalent to calling CobbAPICell.SetLightingTemplateUsageFlags(akSubject, 0xFFFFFFFF, False, abPersist).

method.name: GetAcousticSpace
method.blurb: Returns an interior cell's acoustic space.

method.name: GetAmbientColor
method.blurb: Returns an interior cell's ambient light color as a single integer. Fails if called on an exterior cell.

method.name: GetChanges
method.blurb: Returns bitmasks representing the changes that have been made to a cell using CobbAPI. This will detect changes that are set to persist, but not changes that aren't.

description.p: This function can be used to check for persistent changes made to an interior cell's lighting using CobbAPI. It returns an array of two bitmasks. The first is a mask of all changed properties on the cell. The second is a mask of all changed lighting template usage flags on the cell.
The properties mask uses these bits:

method.name: GetDirectionalAmbientColors
method.blurb: Returns a cell's directional ambient colors.
method.description: If called on an interior cell that does not use sky lighting, this function returns an array of six integers representing the cell's directional ambient colors in this order: +X, -X, +Y, -Y, +Z, -Z. If called on an invalid cell, this function fails, logging a Papyrus error and returning a zero-length array.

method.name: GetDirectionalColor
method.blurb: Returns an interior cell's directional light color as a single integer. Fails if called on an exterior cell.
method.description: If called on an interior cell that does not use sky lighting, this function returns the cell's directional light color. If called on an invalid cell, this function fails, logging a Papyrus error and returning zero.

method.name: GetDirectionalFade
method.blurb: Returns an interior cell's directional light fade. Fails if called on an exterior cell.
method.description: If called on an interior cell that does not use sky lighting, this function returns the cell's directional light fade. If called on an invalid cell, this function fails, logging a Papyrus error and returning zero.

method.name: GetDirectionalRotation
method.blurb: Returns an interior cell's directional rotation as an array of two integers: the XY rotation in degrees, and the Z rotation in degrees. Fails if called on an exterior cell.
method.description: If called on an interior cell that does not use sky lighting, this function returns an array of two integers representing the cell's directional lighting angle: the first integer is the XY rotation in degrees, and the second is the Z rotation in degrees. If called on an invalid cell, this function fails, logging a Papyrus error and returning a zero-length array.

method.name: GetEncounterZone
method.blurb: Returns a cell's encounter zone.

method.name: GetExteriorCellCoordinates
method.blurb: Returns an exterior cell's grid coordinates.

description.p: If this function is given an exterior cell, it returns that cell's grid coordinates as an array of two integers, one for the X-coordinate and one for the Y-coordinate. If this function is given an interior cell, it logs a Papyrus error and returns a zero-length array.

method.name: GetExteriorUnitCoordinates
method.blurb: Returns an exterior cell's world coordinates.

description.p: If this function is given an exterior cell, it returns that cell's world coordinates as an array of two floats, one for the X-coordinate and one for the Y-coordinate. If this function is given an interior cell, it logs a Papyrus error and returns a zero-length array.

method.name: GetFogColors
method.blurb: Returns an array of an interior cell's near and far fog colors. Fails if called on an exterior cell, or on an interior cell that uses sky lighting.
method.description: If called on an interior cell that does not use sky lighting, this function returns an array of two integers representing the cell's near and far fog colors. If called on an invalid cell, this function fails, logging a Papyrus error and returning a zero-length array.

method.name: GetFogDistances
method.blurb: Returns an array of an interior cell's fog near, fog far, and fog clip distances. Fails if called on an exterior cell, or on an interior cell that uses sky lighting.
method.description: If called on an interior cell that does not use sky lighting, this function returns an array of three floats representing the cell's fog near, fog far, and fog clip distances. If called on an invalid cell, this function fails, logging a Papyrus error and returning a zero-length array.

method.name: GetFogMax
method.blurb: Returns an interior cell's fog max. Fails if called on an exterior cell, or on an interior cell that uses sky lighting.
method.description: If called on an interior cell that does not use sky lighting, this function returns the fog max value. If called on an invalid cell, this function fails, logging a Papyrus error and returning zero.

method.name: GetFogPow
method.blurb: Returns an interior cell's fog power. Fails if called on an exterior cell, or on an interior cell that uses sky lighting.
method.description: If called on an interior cell that does not use sky lighting, this function returns the fog power value. If called on an invalid cell, this function fails, logging a Papyrus error and returning zero.

method.name: GetImageSpace
method.blurb: Returns an interior cell's imagespace. Fails if called on an exterior cell.

method.name: GetLightFadeDistances
method.blurb: Returns an array of an interior cell's "begin" and "end" light fade distances. Fails if called on an exterior cell.
method.description: If called on an interior cell that does not use sky lighting, this function returns an array of two floats representing the cell's "begin" and "end" light fade distances. If called on an invalid cell, this function fails, logging a Papyrus error and returning a zero-length array.

method.name: GetLightingTemplate
method.blurb: Returns the lighting template that the cell is using.

method.name: GetLightingTemplateUsageDefaultFlag

args.arg: A lighting template usage flag. See the list in the main article for the CobbAPICell class.

method.blurb: Checks a cell's original data (i.e. before any run-time changes made by CobbAPI) and returns True if the given lighting template usage flag is set, or False otherwise.

method.name: GetLightingTemplateUsageDefaultFlags
method.blurb: Checks a cell's original data (i.e. before any run-time changes made by CobbAPI) and returns the cell's lighting template usage flags.

method.name: GetLightingTemplateUsageFlag

args.arg: A lighting template usage flag. See the list in the main article for the CobbAPICell class.

method.blurb: Returns True if the given lighting template usage flag is set, or False otherwise.

method.name: GetLightingTemplateUsageFlags
method.blurb: Returns the cell's lighting template usage flags.

method.name: GetMusicType
method.blurb: Returns an interior cell's music-type. Fails if called on an exterior cell.

method.name: GetNorthRotation
method.blurb: Returns a cell's north rotation, honoring any NorthMarkers in the cell.

method.name: GetParentWorldspace
method.blurb: Returns a cell's parent Worldspace. For interior cells, this is always None.

method.name: IsFieldChanged

args.arg: A bitmask of properties to check. If multiple properties are specified, then they must all be changed in order for this function to return True.

method.blurb: Checks whether one or more cell lighting properties are flagged as "changed" within CobbAPI. This will detect changes that are set to persist, but not changes that aren't.

method.name: IsLightingTemplateUsageFlagChanged

args.arg: A bitmask of template usage flags to check. If multiple flags are specified, then they must all be changed in order for this function to return True.

method.blurb: Checks whether one or more of a cell's lighting template usage flags are flagged as "changed" within CobbAPI. This will detect changes that are set to persist, but not changes that aren't.

method.name: IsPublic
method.blurb: Returns True if the cell has the "Is Public" flag set, or False otherwise.

method.name: ResetFields

args.arg: A bitmask of properties to revert changes to.

method.blurb: Resets the specified properties for a cell, but not any changes to the lighting template usage flags associated with those properties.

example-data.comment: Reset changes to the directional ambient colors.

method.name: ResetTemplateUsageFlags

args.arg: A bitmask of flags to reset. Every bit that is 1 in this mask will be reset to its original value in the cell's lighting template usage flags.

method.blurb: Resets the specified lighting template usage flags for a cell.

method.name: SetAcousticSpace

args.arg: If this argument is True, then the change will be persisted in the SKSE co-save.

method.blurb: Forces a cell to use a different acoustic space.

method.name: SetAmbientColor

args.arg: If this parameter is set to True, then the cell will be forced to use your color even if it is using a lighting template. It's equivalent to an appropriate call to SetLightingTemplageUsageFlags, to clear the lighting template usage flag for this color.

If both the abForce and abFixOther parameters are true, then the cell will copy the directional ambient colors from its lighting template. This option exists because a cell can inherit both the single ambient color and the six directional ambient colors from its lighting template, or it can inherit none of these colors; it cannot inherit just one. Using abForce and setting just one of those will produce a visible change in the other color(s) unless the other color(s) is/are copied from the lighting template to the cell, and abFixOther controls whether that copy operation is performed.
If this argument is True, then the change will be persisted in the SKSE co-save.

method.blurb: Modifies a cell's ambient lighting color.

description.p: This function modifies an interior cell's ambient lighting color. The ambient color isn't actually used at run-time; it is used in the Creation Kit to auto-generate the six directional ambient colors.

method.name: SetDirectionalAmbientColors

args.arg: Six integers representing directional ambient colors to set.

If this parameter is set to True, then the cell will be forced to use your color even if it is using a lighting template. It's equivalent to an appropriate call to SetLightingTemplageUsageFlags, to clear the lighting template usage flag for this color.

If both the abForce and abFixOther parameters are true, then the cell will copy the single ambient color from its lighting template. This option exists because a cell can inherit both the single ambient color and the six directional ambient colors from its lighting template, or it can inherit none of these colors; it cannot inherit just one. Using abForce and setting just one of those will produce a visible change in the other color(s) unless the other color(s) is/are copied from the lighting template to the cell, and abFixOther controls whether that copy operation is performed.
If this argument is True, then the change will be persisted in the SKSE co-save.

method.blurb: Modifies a cell's directional ambient lighting colors.

method.name: SetDirectionalColor

args.arg: If this parameter is set to True, then the cell will be forced to use your color even if it is using a lighting template. It's equivalent to an appropriate call to SetLightingTemplageUsageFlags, to clear the lighting template usage flag for this color.
If this argument is True, then the change will be persisted in the SKSE co-save.

method.blurb: Modifies a cell's directional lighting color.

method.name: SetDirectionalFade

args.arg: If this parameter is set to True, then the cell will be forced to use your color even if it is using a lighting template. It's equivalent to an appropriate call to SetLightingTemplageUsageFlags, to clear the lighting template usage flag for this color.
If this argument is True, then the change will be persisted in the SKSE co-save.

method.blurb: Modifies a cell's directional lighting fade.

method.name: SetDirectionalRotation

args.arg: An array of two integers, the first representing an XY rotation in degrees and the second representing a Z rotation in degrees.

If this parameter is set to True, then the cell will be forced to use your color even if it is using a lighting template. It's equivalent to an appropriate call to SetLightingTemplageUsageFlags, to clear the lighting template usage flag for this color.
If this argument is True, then the change will be persisted in the SKSE co-save.

method.blurb: Modifies a cell's directional lighting rotation.

method.name: SetFog

args.arg: If this parameter is set to True, then the cell will be forced to use your color even if it is using a lighting template. It's equivalent to an appropriate call to SetLightingTemplageUsageFlags, to clear the lighting template usage flag for this color.
If this argument is True, then the change will be persisted in the SKSE co-save.

method.blurb: A shorthand setter for all of an interior cell's fog properties.

method.name: SetFogColors

args.arg: If this parameter is set to True, then the cell will be forced to use your colors even if it is using a lighting template. It's equivalent to an appropriate call to SetLightingTemplageUsageFlags, to clear the lighting template usage flag for these colors.
If this argument is True, then the change will be persisted in the SKSE co-save.

method.blurb: Modifies a cell's near and far fog colors.

method.name: SetFogDistanceClip

args.arg: If this parameter is set to True, then the cell will be forced to use your color even if it is using a lighting template. It's equivalent to an appropriate call to SetLightingTemplageUsageFlags, to clear the lighting template usage flag for this color.
If this argument is True, then the change will be persisted in the SKSE co-save.

method.blurb: Modifies a cell's fog clip distance.

method.name: SetFogDistanceFar

args.arg: If this parameter is set to True, then the cell will be forced to use your color even if it is using a lighting template. It's equivalent to an appropriate call to SetLightingTemplageUsageFlags, to clear the lighting template usage flag for this color.
If this argument is True, then the change will be persisted in the SKSE co-save.

method.blurb: Modifies a cell's far fog distance.

method.name: SetFogDistanceNear

args.arg: If this parameter is set to True, then the cell will be forced to use your color even if it is using a lighting template. It's equivalent to an appropriate call to SetLightingTemplageUsageFlags, to clear the lighting template usage flag for this color.
If this argument is True, then the change will be persisted in the SKSE co-save.

method.blurb: Modifies a cell's near fog distance.

method.name: SetFogDistances

args.arg: If this parameter is set to True, then the cell will be forced to use your color even if it is using a lighting template. It's equivalent to an appropriate call to SetLightingTemplageUsageFlags, to clear the lighting template usage flag for this color.
If this argument is True, then the change will be persisted in the SKSE co-save.

method.blurb: Modifies an interior cell's near, far, and clip fog distances.

method.name: SetFogFarColor

args.arg: If this parameter is set to True, then the cell will be forced to use your colors even if it is using a lighting template. It's equivalent to an appropriate call to SetLightingTemplageUsageFlags, to clear the lighting template usage flag for these colors.

If both the abForce and abFixOther parameters are true, then the cell will copy the near fog color from its lighting template. This option exists because a cell can inherit both fog colors from its lighting template, or neither color; it cannot inherit just one. Using abForce and setting just one fog color will produce a visible change in the other color unless the other color is copied from the lighting template to the cell, and abFixOther controls whether that copy operation is performed.
If this argument is True, then the change will be persisted in the SKSE co-save.

method.blurb: Modifies a cell's far fog color.

method.name: SetFogMax

args.arg: If this parameter is set to True, then the cell will be forced to use your color even if it is using a lighting template. It's equivalent to an appropriate call to SetLightingTemplageUsageFlags, to clear the lighting template usage flag for this color.
If this argument is True, then the change will be persisted in the SKSE co-save.

method.blurb: Modifies a cell's fog max.

method.name: SetFogPow

args.arg: If this parameter is set to True, then the cell will be forced to use your color even if it is using a lighting template. It's equivalent to an appropriate call to SetLightingTemplageUsageFlags, to clear the lighting template usage flag for this color.
If this argument is True, then the change will be persisted in the SKSE co-save.

method.blurb: Modifies a cell's fog power.

method.name: SetFogNearColor

args.arg: If this parameter is set to True, then the cell will be forced to use your colors even if it is using a lighting template. It's equivalent to an appropriate call to SetLightingTemplageUsageFlags, to clear the lighting template usage flag for these colors.

If both the abForce and abFixOther parameters are true, then the cell will copy the far fog color from its lighting template. This option exists because a cell can inherit both fog colors from its lighting template, or neither color; it cannot inherit just one. Using abForce and setting just one fog color will produce a visible change in the other color unless the other color is copied from the lighting template to the cell, and abFixOther controls whether that copy operation is performed.
If this argument is True, then the change will be persisted in the SKSE co-save.

method.blurb: Modifies a cell's near fog color.

method.name: SetImageSpace

args.arg: If this argument is True, then the change will be persisted in the SKSE co-save.

method.blurb: Forces a cell to use a different imagespace.

method.name: SetLightFadeDistances

args.arg: If this parameter is set to True, then the cell will be forced to use your values even if it is using a lighting template. It's equivalent to an appropriate call to SetLightingTemplageUsageFlags, to clear the lighting template usage flag for these values.
If this argument is True, then the change will be persisted in the SKSE co-save.

method.blurb: Modifies an interior cell's light fade distances.

method.name: SetLightingTemplate

args.arg: If this argument is True, then the change will be persisted in the SKSE co-save.

method.blurb: Forces a cell to use a different lighting template form.

method.name: SetLightingTemplateUsageFlags

args.arg: A bitmask of flags to modify. Every bit that is 1 in this mask will be modified as indicated by the other arguments.
Whether to set (True) or clear (False) the indicated flags.
If this argument is True, then the change will be persisted in the SKSE co-save.

method.blurb: Modifies the specified lighting template usage flags for a cell.

method.name: SetMusicType

args.arg: If this argument is True, then the change will be persisted in the SKSE co-save.

method.blurb: Forces a cell to use a different music-type.

method.name: StopPersistingChangedTemplateUsageFlags

args.arg: A bitmask of flags to modify. Every bit that is 1 in this mask will stop being persisted in the savegame until it is next altered.

method.blurb: Stops persisting changes to the specified lighting template usage flags in the savegame, without actually resetting the cell's in-memory data.

method.name: StopPersistingChangesTo

args.arg: A bitmask of properties to stop persisting changes to.

method.blurb: Stops persisting changes to the specified lighting properties for an interior cell. The changes aren't actually reverted; we just stop bothering to write them to the SKSE co-save, at least until they are next changed.

example-data.comment: Stop persisting changes to the directional ambient colors.

method.name: UsesSkyLighting
method.blurb: Returns True if the cell is an exterior cell, or if it is an interior cell with the "Use Sky Lighting" flag set. Returns False otherwise.
